meanings.def: having a job for which you are paid
examples: the working population
working people/mothers/families

meanings.def: having a job that involves hard physical work rather than office work, studying, etc.
examples: a working man
the working masses
a TV drama about an ordinary working man

meanings.def: connected with your job and the time you spend doing it
examples: long working hours
poor working conditions
I have a good working relationship with my boss.
She spent most of her working life as a teacher.
recent changes in working practices
insights into Rembrandt's working methods

meanings.def: a working breakfast or lunch is one at which you discuss business
used as a basis for work, discussion, etc. but likely to be changed or improved in the future
examples: a working theory
Have you decided on a working title for your thesis yet?
It's simply a working document at present.

meanings.def: if you have a working knowledge of something, you can use it at a basic level
the working parts of a machine are the parts that move in order to make it function
a working majority is a small majority that is enough to enable a government to win votes in parliament and make new laws

examples: The engine is now in perfect working order.
The engine is now in perfect working order.
Working with animals requires patience.
More businesses now offer flexible working.

meanings.def: the way in which a machine, a system, an organization, etc. works
examples: an introduction to the workings of Congress
the workings of the human mind
the machine’s inner workings

meanings.def: the parts of a mine or quarry where coal, metal, stone, etc. is or has been dug from the ground
examples: A pump was used to remove water from the old workings.
